thread.title: Ambassador Arun Kumar Singh Discusses President Obama Administration Led US/India Relation’s, @GM Investment & More
thread.title_full: Ambassador Arun Kumar Singh Discusses President Obama Administration Led US/India Relation’s, @GM Investment & More

author: WoodlawnPost
title: Ambassador Arun Kumar Singh Discusses President Obama Administration Led US/India Relation’s, @GM Investment & More
text:
Press Releases Ambassador Arun Kumar Singh Discusses President Obama Administration Led US/India Relation’s, @GM Investment & More 
DETROIT, Michigan – His Excellency Arun Kumar Singh, the Indian Ambassador to the U.S., spoke to the Detroit Economic Club on October 16th about President Barack Obama Administration led US/India relation’s, General Motors Investment in India along with the Economic future of India. “President Obama has defined the US India relationship as a defining relationship,” said Ambassador Arun Kumar Singh. To date U.S. President Barack Obama has visited India twice and under the leadership of his Administraion & Prime Minister Modi, the India/US relationsip has been revitalized and rechanged. “Ties between US and India have never been stronger,” said Ambassador Arun Kumar Singh. During Prime Minister Modi’s visit to the US last month there was a focus on renewable energy, innovation along with entrepreneurship. “As India grows, it is bound to create enourmous opportunities for US businesses in a wide range of sectors,” said Ambassador Arun Kumar Singh. General Motors had announced plans to invest $1 Billion in India by 2020 potentially making the coutry a manufactoring base as India’s GDP grew 7% year over year during Q1 of Fiscal Year 2015. Source: DEC Tweet
